text: each year there are those cooking
Thanksgiving for the very first time and
inevitably some of those people forget
that it takes so long for a turkey to
defrost from the freezer today I'm going
to show you a shortcut in Vaughn your
turkey but I'm also going to show you
the proper way to do so so I have a
frozen 12 pound turkey here and the best
way to thaw it out is in the
refrigerator and on a rimmed baking
sheet you want to make sure you have a
rimmed baking sheet to catch any juices
breast side up in the refrigerator and
for every four pounds of turkey meat
that you have you want to allow one full
day in the refrigerator for thawing so
that would take this turkey here three
days to thaw now if you don't have that
time I'm going to show you a shortcut
and that is using cold water so take
your frozen turkey and place it rest
side down in cold water now you can do
this in a large pot you could do this in
your sink or you could even use a cooler
and you want to make sure that you
completely cover the turkey with cold
water if you need to weight it down you
should do that a nice baking dish would
work well here now you need to change
the water over every 30 minutes new cold
water so that the turkey stays nice and
well chilled but it's still defrost and
for a 12 pound turkey like this it will
take about six hours to defrost that's
thirty minutes per pound and it does
take some time but it is definitely a
quicker method of thawing out your bird
so there you go kitchen conundrum for
this Thanksgiving is solved
